sushi_nastran

sushi_nastran.hdf5

get_eigenvals(h5_filename)

This function extracts eigenvalues (not vectors) from a supplied HDF5 files and returns as a dictionary.

Parameters
h5_filenamestr

Name of the HDF5 file.

Returns
eig_valsdict

Dictionary that contains eigenvalues, omega, and frequency.

Notes

Updated: 4/21/2022

sushi_nastran.kmp

read_kmp(fname, *args)

This function will read the stiffness \((K)\), mass \((M)\) and force \((P)\) matirx written out by NASTRAN in .pch format. To export the KMP puch file from NASTRAN, include PARAM,EXTOUT,DMIGPCH card.

Parameters
fnamestr

Punch file name.

*argsstr

Pass "P" in the .pch file inlcudes a force vector and if you would like read that as well. Not case sensitive.

Returns
kmpdict

A dictionary of stiffness, mass, and force matirx. format = {str: ndarray}

Notes

Cannot handle extremely large matrices due to memory issues.

Examples

>>> read_kmp("kmp_file.pch", "p")

sushi_nastran.nas_utils

spaces(var)

Returns the spaces needed to fill the rest of field. Assumes the small field with 8 characters.

Parameters
Exp: str

A field value.

Returns
fillerstr

8-len(var) number of empty spaces.

sushi_nastran.rigids

generate_rbe2_file(dof, num_nodes, ele_id_start, d_nodes_start, ind_nodes_start)

This function generates a text file that contains the Nastran input for a RBE2 connection.

Parameters
dofint

RBE2 degrees of freedom.

num_nodes: int

The number of RBE2 cards to write out.

ele_id_start: int

Element ID start number

d_nodes_start: int

Dependent nodes start number

ind_nodes_start: int

Independent nodes start number.

Returns
A file named RBE2_Input_Nastran.txt with the RBE2 cards.

Notes

List must be supplied in int format as this function will convert it to strings.

Examples

>>> generate_rbe2_file(123, 25, 100, 500,600)
